thread.title: 2 people killed in plane crash in Brazoria County, Texas, authorities confirm - @KPRC2
thread.title_full: 2 people killed in plane crash in Brazoria County, Texas, authorities confirm - @KPRC2

author: Jillian Stampher
title: 2 people killed in plane crash in Brazoria County, Texas, authorities confirm - @KPRC2
text:
Aerials of deadly plane crash in Brazoria County BRAZORIA COUNTY, Texas - 
Two people were killed in a plane crash Tuesday in Brazoria County. 
The Brazoria County Sheriff's Office said the plane was traveling north through Brazoria County when it crashed into a field near CR 306. Officials said the aircraft rolled several times and came to a rest with its nose facing north. 
The owner of the plane has been identified as David Leining, 63, from Santa Fe in Galveston County. The passenger was Robert Mena, 57, who was a retired state trooper who worked out of the Texas City Department of Public Safety Office. Quick Clicks 
(Photo by Sarah Rencurrel/The Facts of Brazoria County) 
(Photo by Sarah Rencurrel/The Facts of Brazoria County) (Photo by Sarah Rencurrel/The Facts of Brazoria County) 
The Federal Aviation Administration released a statement that read in part: 
"The Federal Aviation Administration and the National Transportation Safety Board are investigating the crash of a small aircraft, the remains of which were found by a passerby at about 10 a.m. Central time, July 14, in the San Bernard Refuge area of Brazoria County, Texas." 
There is no word yet on what caused the crash. The crash remains under investigation.
